intro: Monnina eriocarpa, commonly known as silky monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The species is part of the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants such as willowherbs and evening primroses.
